connectionToPtLawrence: Ken Culver grew up at the Pt. Lawrence Lodge and purchased the property from his father, Carroll Culver, in the late 1960s.

family.parents: Carroll Nelson Culver and Jean (Rothenhafer) Culver

timeline.event: Grew up at Point Lawrence Lodge
Attended University of Washington (was on crew team)
Lived on Lake Union houseboat during college
Late 1960s: Purchased Point Lawrence Lodge from father Carroll Culver

biography:
The Boats in My Lifeâ€”and Other Ramblings (Ken Culver, December 23, 2024)

Extensive memoir (~50,000 words) about growing up at Point Lawrence Lodge and his lifelong relationship with boats. Key topics covered:

- Early jobs as a boy: netting fish for resort customers, jigging herring for bait ($1/dozen)
- Family boats including the Kokanee (#0377), rental boats at the Lodge
- High school years: building homemade water skis with Dwight Reed
- University of Washington: lived on Lake Union houseboat, was on crew team
- Various boats owned throughout life: 16' Reinell inboard, 18' Thunderbird, and many others
- Eventually settled in Bellingham area

The memoir provides rich detail about life at Point Lawrence Lodge, the fishing resort operations, and the evolution of boating technology from the 1950s onward.
miscellaneous: Primary source of many photos in the archive. Grew up working at the family fishing resort. Expert at netting large salmon. Key figure in preserving Point Lawrence Lodge history.
researchQuestions: What years did Ken attend University of Washington?
notes: Page contains extensive memoir 'The Boats in My Life' (~56,000 characters) dated December 23, 2024
